snippet: The agency gave Congess more time to act and said it would offer early retirement incentives to tens of thousands of employees.
abstract: United States Postal Service announces that it will keep hundreds of small post offices open by reducing business hours or offering stamps and packaging in grocery stores; new plan whittles down ambitious overhaul that would have closed thousands of offices.

byline.original: By RON NIXON and JOHN H. CUSHMAN Jr

lead_paragraph: The agency gave Congess more time to act and said it would offer early retirement incentives to tens of thousands of employees.

headline.seo: Postal Service Alters Plan to Cut Costs
headline.main: Postal Service Holds Back on Closings
headline.print_headline: Postal Service Alters Plan to Cut Costs

keywords.value: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee
keywords.name: organizations
